City of Roxboro, NC
WWTP Chlorine Executive Summary - 2004

The City of Roxboro continues to implement a comprehensive program to safely manage chlorine at its Water Treatment Plant. Chlorine is used in the disinfection process of treating water as part of the water purification process. There have been no chlorine incidents or accidents in the most recent Five-Year history period.

The Process Safety Management (PSM) that was completed in 1996 has been maintained current for the past five years. The PSM compliance also demonstrates our compliance with the Risk Management Program (RMP) Prevention Program. Key activities have included:

oAn annual review of  all chlorine, PSM and RMP procedures
oThree Year Refreshed training conducted on June 18, 2004
oA Process Hazards Analysis conducted in October 28, 2002 
oSelf Audits every three years with the last one on October 28, 2004
oA comprehensive Mechanical Integrity program that uses outside expertise to maintain chlorine equipment in top shape
oAn annual review and update of the Emergency Response Plan including periodic drills 

In addition to these compliance activities, the City of Roxboro has implemented these chlorine safety controls

oThe chlorine delivery system has been upgraded to a state-of-the art vacuum system
oThe site is limiting the amount of chlorine on site to a maximum of six cylinders

Within the Utilities department, there are monthly safety meeting to review an OSHA subject or discuss a safety issue. Routine training is conducted for topics such as:

oHazard Communications
oPersonal Protective Equipment
oLockout/Tagout
oSite Security
oConfined Space

As a result of our programs, the plant has had an excellent safety record. We plan to continue our emphasis on safety to maintain and improve our safety performance.                                    
                                   
Report by:
Lindsay Mize
Public Services Director
